title: Sonicode
desc: Sonicode is a performance piece producing audio-visual work derived from barcodes. The barcode is input using a wireless scanner and informs a rhythmic pattern made of audio samples that I have collected from items around my flat.

title: Murmur, Swoosh, Retch
desc: Romain Biros and Hannah Corrie in collaboration with Mass Hysteria created a performance for Deptford Moving Image festival. The visual effects consist of revisiting the cinematographic processes of slit-scanning and image repetition using advanced software and hardware programming.

title: Interactive Instrument
desc: This is a sonic installation that responds to sounds in a room, and can be played and performed with as a semi-controllable, semi-uncontrollable instrument.

title: Reciprocal
desc: Reciprocal is a live performance experience using a cello and live electronics to create a singular augmented instrument in sensory immersion. The bow for a cellist is an extension of their arm. The movement of this relation is used as a controller for the audio synthesis.

title: The Sound of Poetry
desc: This is a poetry reading with ambient sound background that's triggerred by the way that the verses are read. The process of this project is half about collaging sound and half about analyzing the sound of poetry.

title: JESTLED
desc: JESTLED is experiment in bridging the real world to virtual reality. Oculus Quest controllers are used to conduct a display of vibrant colourful lights along a strip of LEDs.

title: Light up the Balls
desc: As an audiovisual(AV) interactive art, it engages the audience with their hand gesture to generate rhythmic visuals such as ‘lighting and dancing balls’ which produce mixing sounds with the beat as well. The Machine Learning helps them to participate as VJ Producer.

title: Neo-4'33
desc: Sound is constant and everywhere. Sound is time-based medium. The layered sound create a timeline, but it is disappear and immateriality. Sound is also the atmosphere and space. Neo-4'33 is the sound art piece that adopted idea of experimental composer John Cage's art piece call 4'33.

title: Jeff in a Jar - Prototype 1.0
desc: Jeff in a Jar imagines a dystopian future world where the space colonisation dreams of Jeff Bezos have come true. Though the inhabitants of Jeff’s space colony have long since perished, Jeff’s brain lives on, still thinking it’s in control of a vast galactic empire.

title: WordsOfRebellion
desc: Collection and transcription of protest posters that crossed the streets of Chile (2019-20). While being abroad, social networks has been my main access to those images. This proposal is an attempt to build a story mediated by the digital platform as a narrative, sensitive and knowledge source.

title: Drips
desc: Drips is the product of a research project into biosensing (self tracking health data) as a practice, and reflective writing as a creative research technique.

title: Detuned piano
desc: Detuned piano is an audio&light interactive installation. It is aiming to reflect the impact of the misleading information we find on the Internet and the impact of them on the mental health of people.

title: A Magical AI Angle
desc: A prototype for the sonic part of an interactive installation. The piece takes viewer to an insecure AI oracle that reads aloud predictions about its own future. The name comes from one of the phrases in AI predictions. Built with MaxMSP,  Arduino and a text generation RNN in Tensorflow.

title: Digital fossil
desc: Digital fossil is a research project about compressing human information in the future, including parts of genotypes and our personal traces on the internet.

title: Weaving Drafts at the Edge of the Abyss
desc: A series of experimental explorations into digital weaving drafts/notation. The project is founded on a series of vague questions about time, nature, relationality and pattern-making which are engaged with through the creation of generative and interactive digital and physical weaving drafts.

title: Creating with Machine Learning
desc: In this presentation I am going to talk about my approach to creative computing using different Neural Networks in Machine Learning. There are two pieces that I will be taking about, the first is a disobedient installation and the second a computational clone.

title: The Snow Globe
desc: A diorama

title: I am my sex slave
desc: I am my sex slave is focusing on the process of produce a virtual body by different 3D scanning platforms and techniques, exploring the possibility of our identity development without the restriction of the physical body in the real-world.

title: Is It Getting Better?
desc: This kinetic sculpture changes its shape depending on the latest COVID19 data in the UK. It automatically interrogates an online data source once per day. Its two states (better / worse) aims at simplifying the understanding of the data and go against the current information overload.

title: Public Opinion
desc: An audio performance that has a socio-political bent to it about how we lose our own unique voice within the onslaught of pervasive media. It's strongly based off of media and public opinion literature. It takes its name from the highly influential and controversial 1922 book by Walter Lippmann.

title: Stop Projecting Your Feelings Onto Others
desc: Stop projecting your feelings onto others is a computational interact projection and installation, reflecting the projection effect in Psychology.

title: #iorestoacasa
desc: #iorestoacasa is a virtual artefact that visualizes data relative to the COVID-19 pandemic in the form of a particle system. The most relevant data about the virus outbreak is mapped to variables that modify the shape and color of the system.

title: a human and a computer
desc: This performance is a human-computer collaboration. The human improvises on an electric guitar, whilst the computer generates a response using MaxMSP, resulting in a sound collage. The piece focuses on aspects of generative audio and human-computer interaction.

title: Sumbios
desc: Here Physarum Polycephalum explores its natural habitats using soundscapes and reactive visuals. The soundscape of the room also plays effect on these visuals exhibited, that alter our abstraction of the relationship between the biological worlds and the Anthropocene.

title: Cash Cow
desc: ‘Cash Cow’ is an audiovisual performance piece aimed at raising awareness about the treatment of cattle and other non-human animals in the context of industrial animal farming. The audio used is the poem/song ‘The Revolution Will Not Be Televised’ by American poet and jazz musician Gil Scott-Heron.

title: CrowMisoMoon
desc: During lockdown, I’m more aware of the world around me, specifically the omnipresent crows on Hackney Marshes. I’ve been recording ‘conversations’ with these creatures, who seem to be flourishing in the absence of people. I’ve combined the recordings with an interactive ‘terraforming’ visual in Max.

title: Symbiosis
desc: Symbiosis is a piece which explores the parasitic and mutualistic relationships between the  plant and animal kingdom in the form of a 3D simulation. All three kingdoms rely on each other for food, growth and survival.

title: Feral Robotic Birds
desc: Birdsong adapts and responds to sonic changes in the environment.  Using nightingale songs as a start-point, Feral Robotic Birds speculate the future of birdsong by listening to their environments, and slowly incorporating the sonic history of those environments into their ever-changing songs.

title: Everything Glitched
desc: I woke up one morning and everything had glitched.  This work is an audio-visual response to the Covid 19 lockdown.  Deliberately repetitive and at times off-key, the work expresses the unease of this time.

title: For the Tide!
desc: This project is a first step to understand the Thames Tide ecosystem and pave new horizons in designing with the Tide.

title: Algerian Hand Gestures
desc: This interactive project uses a camera to detect hand gestures and a speaker to produce corresponding verbal sounds.

title: Replica
desc: This artwork will tell a story of my digital plant and I in a cyberpunk way. I raised some questions based on the semiotics of plant and human and started my project with these. Can I keep my dying plants forever? Can I be my plant, and can we be together?

title: Wave Scape in Lake
desc: It represents 'Acoustic harmony of multispecies' such as goose and ducks in Lake as an aspect of the biodiversity in nature. It goes through 'how they live together' by generative waves with 'Binaural Spatial Sound'. As a musical, I perform with species and generate audiovisual art on my movement.

title: Translucence
desc: “Translucence” is a virtual space constructed from various embodiments of my fragmented memories, taking the form of poetry, sculpture, still image, video clips, and animations. The visitor becomes a thread that connects these different elements by controlling an invisible avatar in the space.

title: A Rose is a Rose is a Rose
desc: This project is a 3D visualisation of different rose shapes, based on the geometrical concept of the Maurer Rose by Peter M. Maurer. The title of this project was inspired by Gertrude Stein’s 1913 poem titled "Sacred Emily," which contains the famous verse, "Rose is a rose is a rose is a rose."

title: "Οικολογία" (ecologia)
desc: “Ecologia” is a piece dedicated, as the title describes, to ecology, it reflects on humans improvident plastic waste and it creates an imaginary soundscape by sonifing the image of all land fields of earth bulging with plastics.

title: Inside Us - A VR experience
desc: "Inside Us" is a VR experience of the internal workings of an organism. You float around inside an infected body while blood cells flow around you as well. You are able to see some corona viruses and bacilles as well, each of which are programmed to move according to a certain flocking behaviour.

title: orbiðvēl.V
desc: A meditation on the interaction we have has an individual with the energetic world around us.

title: The heart of the cosmos
desc: The exploration of the combination of biology and astronomy.

title: _dampMap
desc: _dampMap is a browser based generative program which visualises how nations might form in outerspace.

title: How Long Is Now?
desc: What is the present moment, how long is it? This installation attempts to capture a ‘moment’, analysing it to see if a person can have a greater understanding of how they experience time. At what point does time move from slices of time to a continuous duration?

title: Data characters
desc: My interests was in exploring datasets as active participant in the creative process. If data structures come with pre-embedded stories or stories seeds I wanted to give it form that would encourage the process of getting to know each other.

title: The Obscure: Mourning The Lost Art
desc: People are always talking about certain famous paintings that are carefully hung in the museums. However, some same important artworks have vanished forever from human history by some sad reasons. From this moment on, we lost it forever and never feel it without heavily dusty fog.

title: CyKink
desc: 3D abstract interactive program. Inspired by high-dimensional spaceship in a sci-fi fiction.

title: Particles and 3D experimentations
desc:
This project consists on getting data from the KinectV2  to:
 
-       Recreate the 3D scene it observes as accurately as possible
-       Create a 3D explorable world with particles in VR

title: Pyrophonic
desc: Pyrophonic is a prototype for an installation exploring the connection between, sound, fire and ritual. It uses Max, Arduino and Unity to create a semi-intelligible cacophony of religious chants and cultural symbols turned into morphing particle systems, that are triggered by candles.

title: Project about 3D Studio and openFrameworks
desc: For This program, combining 3D Studio and openframeworks, to make dynamic model rendering. After modeling in 3D Studio, import it into the program. Let the program draw the 3D shape we need.

title: Middle Ground
desc: This is an experimentation with semi-structured gamelike formats and mining the uncanny through play. It’s a futile chase around memories and terrors, or otherwise a meditation on change, or otherwise a collection of vignettes. The ‘middle ground’ here is that between remembering and letting go, fearing and desiring, seeking and escaping.

title: Laughing in the Face of Death
desc: In a world under lockdown, how is a young comedian supposed to get a break? Join David R. Mincer in the weird virtual world of his mind as he tries to put on a good show, all while fighting with his own existential struggles.

title: "between"
desc: “Between” is a technoetic live performance that seeks to explore consciousness and connectivity through digital, telematic technologies. The performance combines modern techno dance movements with a traditional form of Chinese Taijiquan, presented through two sets of visualisation.

title: doNOTtouch
desc: doNOTtouch questions the role of the viewer within the art experience. Using a game like format, users are challenged to abide by the signage or succumb to temptation. The gameplay may seem unclear at times but the reward for the user highlights their importance within the sphere of the art object.

title: Boundary
desc: Boundary​ is an audiovisual piece exploring sonification of visual information, and affect in  interactive media. It consists of an interactive 3D environment and a Max application to drive the sound, communicating via OSC messaging.

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Mixed Signals
desc: A work-in progress disobedient chandelier that floats in space and reacts to group dynamics, exploring the themes of affective dissonance and vibrant materialism.

title: The future
desc:
What is democracy?

What does it mean to be governed?

What does it mean to resist?

The piece is a digital writing platform that activates a light installation while typing.  Work-in-progress.
​

title: Computational Spinning Wheel
desc: This installation 'weaves' and controls patterns dependent on the position / speed of a spinning wheel. Designed to be used as a VJ tool / instrument or as a playful installation, I was inspired by a traditional spinning wheel and other spinning machines, such as a lathe and a potter's wheel.

title: You Cannot Recognise
desc: "I cannot recognise" is a work using object detection as social commentary. Pointing out how people rely on algorithm, which is mostly a black box, to identify correct information.

title: "The Usual"
desc: Intrsopective narrative game, exploring the life of a bartender working through quarantine.

title: Performing Objects
desc: This project finds ways to consciously interact with technological objects, becoming performers of the space rather than just the context to it. A ESP32 feather board and an orientation sensor attached to my wrist send data via OSC to a MAX MSP program, controlling the sounds of objects.

title: The Yellow Wallpaper
desc: Reactive visuals for a reading of ‘The Yellow Wallpaper'.The reader’s voice, and intention, interacts with the pattern of the titular paper, creating ornate and unsettling imagery.

title: My Bitrot, Gutweed Breath
desc: an auto-ethnographical interactive audio installation developed from my research of Alexis Pauline Gumbs’ philosophy of breath. The sonic environment of the installation is an idea of how I breathe digitally, with you.

title: #andratuttobene
desc:
#andratuttobene is an interactive installation that conveys the solidarity and positivity of the Italian people in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
The work consists of an ever-fluctuating Italian flag whose revolutions can be controlled through gyroscope data sent as OSC messages over Wi-Fi.

title: Cough, No Free
desc: Cough, No Free is an interactive voice-controlled project to demonstrate the current social situation and release the participant from the serious and depressing atmosphere using pixel art illustrations.

title: Postcards from Lost Cities
desc: Deep learning postcards from tourism destinations hit by the Covid-19 pandemic, capturing the feelings of loss and uncertainty. Coded with PyTorch and TensorFlow in Python. RunwayML used for AttnGAN.

title: The Best Days
desc: The Best Days is a game about student life and mental upkeep. It’s about pushing forward through the days and nights while attempting to stay healthy and sane. It’s a game about the invisible hours spent toiling away in a room without company. These are, in short, the best days of your life.

title: STRINGS
desc: In this live-streamed performance, the audience has to collectively decide how the dancer should move through a web interface. The dancer is wearing electronic devices that react to their actions. Each instruction acts as invisible strings to (re)animate a living and dancing body.

title: Introduction to Computational Arts MA
desc: Computation consists of all the changes brought about by digital technology. Art is an open set of ways of acting inventively in culture. Mixing the two together in a systematic way gives us computational art.

title: orbiðvēl.V
desc: A meditation on the interaction we have has an individual with the energetic world around us.

title: You Cannot Recognise
desc: "I cannot recognise" is a work using object detection as social commentary. Pointing out how people rely on algorithm, which is mostly a black box, to identify correct information.

title: Computing my Latiness
desc: This piece uses MaxMSP and a 360 Kinect to body track a salsa dancer and transform her movements into rambunctious particles.

title: The future
desc:
What is democracy?

What does it mean to be governed?

What does it mean to resist?

The piece is a digital writing platform that activates a light installation while typing.  Work-in-progress.
​

desc: For This program, combining 3D Studio and openframeworks, to make dynamic model rendering. After modeling in 3D Studio, import it into the program. Let the program draw the 3D shape we need.
